description: This course uses major school of economic thought and major economic writers from the past 600 years
to introduce principles of economics.  (See Economics 121.)  Readings include the architects of
capitalism (Adam Smith, David Ricardo, etc.), the critics (Karl Marx, Thorstein Veblem, etc.), and
the reformers (J.M. Keynes, Joseph Schumpeter, J.K. Galbraith, etc.).  Offered many Interims.
fullname: Capitalism: The Struggle of Economic Ideas in History
